intro: Commicarpus commersonii, commonly known as the yellow bursaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, hairy, spherical fruits that burst open to disperse seeds. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
